com.ojcoleman.ahni.util

Class Statistics

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ojcoleman.ahni.util.Statistics

  • public class Statistics
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides methods to perform statistical analysis on a set of results. TODO: provide methods to determine statistical significance between result sets.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected org.apache.commons.math3.stat.descriptive.DescriptiveStatistics[] data
      Stores the raw result data, format is [generation][run].

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Statistics(int generationCount)
      Creates a new empty Statistics for run results consisting of the given number of generations.
      Statistics(Results results)
      Creates a new Statistics based on the given results.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addRun(double[] runData)
      Adds a run to this set of results.
      Results getBasicStats()
      Returns a Results object that contains basic statistics, including mean, standard deviation, minimum, maximum and estimates of 25th, 50th and 75th percentiles.
      org.apache.commons.math3.stat.descriptive.DescriptiveStatistics getData(int generation)
      Returns the underlying DescriptiveStatistics used to store and calculate statistics for the set of runs at the given generation number.

      Get the number of generations represented.

      Returns an array containing the variance over the set of runs for each generation.

      Returns the maximum value over the set of runs at the given generation number.

      Returns the mean (average) over the set of runs at the given generation number.

      Returns an array containing the variance over the set of runs for each generation.

      Returns the minimum value over the set of runs at the given generation number.

      Returns an array containing an estimate for the pth percentile over the set of runs for each generation.

    • Method Detail

      • getRunCount

        public int getRunCount()
        Get the number of runs represented.

      • getGenerationCount

        public int getGenerationCount()
        Get the number of generations represented.

      • addRun

        public void addRun(double[] runData)
        Adds a run to this set of results.
        Parameters:
        runData - An array containing the result from each generation of the run. The length of the array is expected to be the same as getGenerationCount().

      • getMean

        public double getMean(int generation)
        Returns the mean (average) over the set of runs at the given generation number.

      • getStandardDeviation

        public double getStandardDeviation(int generation)
        Returns the standard deviation over the set of runs at the given generation number.

      • getVariance

        public double getVariance(int generation)
        Returns the variance over the set of runs at the given generation number.

      • getPercentile

        public double getPercentile(int generation,
                   double p)
        Returns an estimate for the pth percentile over the set of runs at the given generation number.
        Parameters:
        generation - The generation number to retrieve statistics for.
        p - The requested percentile, in the range (0, 100].

      • getMin

        public double getMin(int generation)
        Returns the minimum value over the set of runs at the given generation number.
        Parameters:
        generation - The generation number to retrieve statistics for.

      • getMax

        public double getMax(int generation)
        Returns the maximum value over the set of runs at the given generation number.
        Parameters:
        generation - The generation number to retrieve statistics for.

      • getData

        public org.apache.commons.math3.stat.descriptive.DescriptiveStatistics getData(int generation)
        Returns the underlying DescriptiveStatistics used to store and calculate statistics for the set of runs at the given generation number. This can be used to perform statistical calculations other than those provided.

      • getMean

        public double[] getMean()
        Returns an array containing the mean (average) over the set of runs for each generation.

      • getStandardDeviation

        public double[] getStandardDeviation()
        Returns an array containing the standard deviation over the set of runs for each generation.

      • getVariance

        public double[] getVariance()
        Returns an array containing the variance over the set of runs for each generation.

      • getPercentile

        public double[] getPercentile(double p)
        Returns an array containing an estimate for the pth percentile over the set of runs for each generation.
        Parameters:
        p - The requested percentile, in the range (0, 100].

      • getMin

        public double[] getMin()
        Returns an array containing the variance over the set of runs for each generation.

      • getMax

        public double[] getMax()
        Returns an array containing the variance over the set of runs for each generation.

      • getBasicStats

        public Results getBasicStats()
        Returns a Results object that contains basic statistics, including mean, standard deviation, minimum, maximum and estimates of 25th, 50th and 75th percentiles.
